TestSet.Name: fcntl

Test.Name: FcntlDupFileDescriptor
Test.Description: F_DUPFD: Find the lowest numbered available file descriptor greater than or equal to arg and make it be a copy of fd.

Test.Name: FcntlGetSetFileStatusFlagsIgnore
Test.Description: F_GETFL, F_SETFL: File access mode (O_RDONLY, O_WRONLY, O_RDWR) and file creation flags (i.e., O_CREAT, O_EXCL, O_NOCTTY, O_TRUNC) in arg are ignored.

Test.Name: FcntlGetSetFileStatusFlags
Test.Description: F_GETFL, F_SETFL: On Linux this command can only change the O_APPEND, O_ASYNC, O_DIRECT, O_NOATIME, and O_NONBLOCK flags.

Test.Name: FcntlGetSetFileDescriptorFlags
Test.Description: F_GETFD, F_SETFD: Currently, only one such flag is defined: FD_CLOEXEC, the close-on-exec flag.

Test.Name: FcntlFDGetLock
Test.Description: F_GETLK: If the lock could be placed, fcntl() does not actually place it, but returns F_UNLCK in the l_type field of lock and leaves the other fields of the structure unchanged.

Test.Name: FcntlFDSetLock
Test.Description: F_SETLK: Acquire a lock (when l_type is F_RDLCK or F_WRLCK) or release a lock (when l_type is F_UNLCK) on the bytes specified by the l_whence, l_start, and l_len fields of lock.

Test.Name: FcntlFDSetLockWithWait
Test.Description: F_SETLKW: As for F_SETLK, but if a conflicting lock is held on the file, then wait for that lock to be released.

Test.Name: FcntlFDNoteDir
Test.Description: F_NOTIFY: Provide notification when the directory referred to by fd is changed.

Test.Name: FcntlFDNoteFile
Test.Description: F_NOTIFY: Provide notification when the directory referred to by fd or any of the files that it contains is changed.

Test.Name: FcntlFDGetSetLease
Test.Description: F_SETLEASE and F_GETLEASE are used (respectively) to establish a new lease, and retrieve the current lease, on the open file description referred to by the file descriptor fd.

Test.Name: FcntlFDGetSetOwn
Test.Description: F_GETOWN and F_SETOWN are used to manage I/O availability signals.

Test.Name: FcntlFDGetSetSig
Test.Description: F_GETSIG and F_SETSIG are used to manage I/O availability signals.

Test.Name: FcntlFDGetSetOwn_Ex
Test.Description: F_GETOWN_EX and F_SETOWN_EX are used to manage I/O availability signals.

Test.Name: FcntlFDGetSetPipeSize
Test.Description: F_SETPIPE_SZ and F_GETPIPE_SZ (since Linux 2.6.35). Changing the capacity of a pipe.

Test.Name: FcntlFDDupWithClExFlag
FcntlFDBadFileDescriptor1
Test.Description: File descriptor open mode doesn't match with the type of lock requested.

Test.Name: FcntlFDBadFileDescriptor2
Test.Description: fd is not opened file descriptor.
Test.Code: ErrorTest(fcntl(-1, F_SETFD, FD_CLOEXEC), -1, EBADF);

Test.Name: FcntlFDTooManyOpenedFiles
Test.Description: For F_DUPFD, the process already has the maximum number of file descriptors open.

Test.Name: FcntlFDInvalidArg1
Test.Description: Setting negative argument for F_DUPFD operation.
Test.Code: ErrorTest(fcntl(1, F_DUPFD, -1), -1, EINVAL);

Test.Name: FcntlFDInvalidArg2
Test.Description: Setting unallowable argument for F_SETSIG operation.
Test.Code: ErrorTest(fcntl(1, F_SETSIG, -1), -1, EINVAL);

Test.Name: FcntlFDInvalidArg3
Test.Description: Setting negative argument to l_whence field of flock structure in locking operations.

Test.Name: FcntlFDBadAdress
Test.Description: Lock is outside your accessible address space.
Test.Code: ErrorTest(fcntl(1, F_SETLK, reinterpret_cast(-1)), -1, EFAULT);

Test.Name: FcntlFDResTempUnavailable
Test.Description: Operation is prohibited by locks held by other processes.

Test.Name: FcntlFDCapAboveLimit
FcntlFDIntrSysCall
Test.Description: For F_SETLKW, the command was interrupted by a signal.
